channel.title: Objectreset command
channel.description: I was just wondering if there was any way to create an "objectreset" command like the "npcreset" command, but with Objects I spawn. Thanks

item.title: Objectreset command
item.dc:creator: @The_Provoked The Provoked
item.description:
@The_Provoked wrote:

[quote=“blitz_9100, post:3, topic:393085”]You can store the objects spawned inside a arraylist, Then have the command remove those objects.

[code]

ArrayList createdObjects = new ArrayList();

…

createdObjects.add(new SpawnedObject(x,y,face,type));

…

if(command.toLowerCase().equals(“resetobjs”)) {
for(SpawnedObject obj : createdObjects) {
// remove object method
// ect…
}
}

[/code][/quote]

Alright, I added that and fixed most of the errors, but I somehow can’t get rid of these two:

client.java:9631: illegal start of type ArrayList<class SpawnedObject>();createdObjects = new ArrayList<SpawnedObject>() ; ^ client.java:9631: ';' expected ArrayList<class SpawnedObject>();createdObjects = new ArrayList<SpawnedObject>() ; ^ 2 errors

Read full topic

item.title: Objectreset command
item.dc:creator: @Ddragonimp Ddragonimp
item.description:
@Ddragonimp wrote:

The Provoked:

No, I’m just wanting to know if there is a command that resets all objects that you’ve spawned. like the Npcreset command resets all the spawned Npc’s that you’ve spawned.

What they do is kill every npc… I dont if you can kill objects since objects havnt been coded to be alive.
But.

You could have it reload this…

NewObjects();

Read full topic

item.title: Objectreset command

couldn’t you just use that?

like implement that into a command.

item.title: Objectreset command
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

You can store the objects spawned inside a arraylist, Then have the command remove those objects.


ArrayList<SpawnedObject> createdObjects = new ArrayList<SpawnedObject>();


...

createdObjects.add(new SpawnedObject(x,y,face,type));

...

if(command.toLowerCase().equals("resetobjs")) {
     for(SpawnedObject obj : createdObjects) {
            // remove object method
           //  ect..
     }
}

Read full topic
